ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.9'

about.description:
TAMkin is a post-processing toolkit for normal mode analysis,
thermochemistry and reaction kinetics. It uses a Hessian computation
from a standard computational chemistry program as its input. CHARMM,
CP2K, CPMD, GAMESS, GAUSSIAN, QCHEM and VASP are supported.
about.summary: TAMkin is a post-processing toolkit for thermochemistry and kinetics analysis.

about.description:
TAMkin is a post-processing toolkit for normal mode analysis,
thermochemistry and reaction kinetics. It uses a Hessian computation
from a standard computational chemistry program as its input. CHARMM,
CP2K, CPMD, GAMESS, GAUSSIAN, QCHEM and VASP are supported.
about.summary: TAMkin is a post-processing toolkit for thermochemistry and kinetics analysis.

name: tamkin
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "tamkin" %}
{% set version = "1.2.6" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://pypi.org/packages/source/{{ name[0] }}/{{ name }}/{{ name }}-{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: fd96f36589a86a72fc9362a7141a6c731d51f76294a54eed225646df280c8b67

build:
  number: 4
  script: "{{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv"
  noarch: python

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - setuptools
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - numpy >=1.0
    - matplotlib-base >1.1
    - molmod >=1.4.5
    - scipy >=0.17.1

test:
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
  imports:
    - tamkin
  commands:
    - pip check

about:
  home: https://github.com/molmod/tamkin
  license: GPL-3.0
  license_family: GPL
  license_file: COPYING
  summary: 'TAMkin is a post-processing toolkit for thermochemistry and kinetics analysis. '

  description: |
    TAMkin is a post-processing toolkit for normal mode analysis, 
    thermochemistry and reaction kinetics. It uses a Hessian computation 
    from a standard computational chemistry program as its input. CHARMM, 
    CP2K, CPMD, GAMESS, GAUSSIAN, QCHEM and VASP are supported. 
  doc_url: http://molmod.github.com/tamkin
  dev_url: https://github.com/molmod/tamkin

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - jan-janssen
    - tovrstra
